## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing a lot about the new Verus testnet. I'm curious, is it a centralized blockchain platform?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the new Verus testnet is an intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform. It allows for unlimited identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains, and is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets. This decentralized nature of the platform enables users to create and manage their own blockchains, currencies, and identities without relying on a central authority. That's one of the key benefits of Verus - it's designed to be community-driven and open.

**User:**
That sounds really interesting. I've got another question related to that. Can I only send currencies within the same chain on the Verus testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you can send currencies not only within the same chain but also across blockchains with ease on the Verus testnet. Additionally, you can even convert currencies to others on the network without an exchange by sending to yourself and converting along the way. The Verus testnet is designed to enable seamless interactions between different blockchains and currencies, making it a powerful platform for decentralized finance and more.
Is the new Verus testnet a centralized blockchain platform?

No, the new Verus testnet is an intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform. It allows for unlimited identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains, and is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets. This decentralized nature of the platform enables users to create and manage their own blockchains, currencies, and identities without relying on a central authority.

## Signing transactions from multi-signature IDs (testnet and mainnet)
Create transaction, get raw transaction data:
  ```
  verus sendcurrency <multi-signature-ID>@ '[{"address":"<destination_address>","amount":<transaction_amount>}]'
  verus z_getoperationstatus <operation_id_returned_by_sendcurrency>
  ```
Take the raw hex transaction data provided by z_getoperationstatus to each additional wallet(s) containing the additional signing addresses/IDs:
  ```
  verus signrawtransaction <raw_hex_transaction>
  ```
After the last necessary signature is applied, broadcast on the network using:
  ```
  verus sendrawtransaction <raw_hex_signed_transaction>
  ```## New Verus Multicurrency, Multichain, DeFi Enabled Testnet
With an easy GUI for basic operations or command line for more advanced functions. Without any programming, you can now create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains for your business, your government, your projects, a worthy cause, your family, or your next decentralized application suite. Send currencies worldwide on the same chain, or across blockchains with ease. Even convert currencies to others on the network without an exchange by sending to yourself and converting along the way.The new Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. It is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets, and it is the beginning of a new age in crypto. There are so many things you can do with Verus that you cannot with any other cryptocurrency platform, and you can try them all today.
